intro: Monotagma congestum, commonly known as the clustered daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features a low-growing habit with numerous small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, often covered in fine hairs. Monotagma congestum is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
